ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: He thought that he was never going to return.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: thinking he would never revert (to Us).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: and had thought that they would never be brought back to life again.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: He assumed that he does not have to return.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Verily, he thought that he would never return!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Surely he thought that he would never return.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: he surely thought he would never revert.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: He verily deemed that he would never return (unto Allah).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: for he never thought that he would have to return [to God].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Verily he imagined that he would not be back.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: and he thought that he would never return.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Truly, did he think that he would not have to return (to Us)!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Verily, he thought that he would never come back (to Us)!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: and surely thought he would never return (to his Lord).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: He thought he would never return.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Indeed, he had thought he would never return [to Allah].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [84:14] indeed he thought that (an: softened in place of the hardened form, with its subject omitted, that is to say, annahu) he would never return, to his Lord.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (He verily deemed that he would never return (unto Allah)) in the Hereafter.
